title: Angkor Wat
additionalInfo: Built in the early 12th century, Angkor Wat is the largest religious monument in the world and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Its stunning architecture and intricate carvings tell the story of ancient Khmer civilization.

title: Kyoto Temples
additionalInfo: Kyoto is home to over 1,600 Buddhist temples, including the famous golden pavilion (Kinkaku-ji) and the serene Zen rock garden at Ryoan-ji. Experience traditional Japanese culture through temple stays and tea ceremonies.

title: Bagan Temples
additionalInfo: The ancient city of Bagan features over 2,000 well-preserved pagodas and temples dating back to the 11th century. Watching the sunrise or sunset over the temple plains from a hot air balloon is an unforgettable experience.
